page.title: 12NOTABLE EVENTS.
page.content: Two events of significance are worthy of record for the year 1985. {END OF MINER'S STRIKE. The strike,fought on the issue of pit closures,came to end in March. Much hardship was endured bythe mining families,but,in this area brought the mining community closer together. One notable feature was the degree of support given to the miners by their wives and families,especially here by the Campsall,Askern and Norton Women's Support Group who organised soup kitchens,Xmas parties,fund raising activites etc,.Support for the hard pressed families also came from the Parish Council and from the Borough Council who provided free meals for children so entitled both during term time and during the school holidays. {THE TWINNING OF NORTON AND NEWHAM.} Much support of the miner's cause,
